1.text: He that separateth himself seeketh [his] pleasure, he is vehement against all sound wisdom.

2.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that his heart may reveal itself.

3.text: When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

4.text: The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters, [and] the fountain of wisdom is a gushing brook.

5.text: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to wrong the righteous in judgment.

6.text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for stripes.

7.text: A fool’s mouth is destruction to him, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

8.text: The words of a talebearer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

9.text: He also who is indolent in his work is brother of the destroyer.

10.text: The name of Jehovah is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

11.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as a high wall in his own imagination.

12.text: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty; and before honour [goeth] humility.

13.text: He that giveth answer before he heareth, it is folly and shame unto him.

14.text: The spirit of a man sustaineth his infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear?

15.text: The heart of an intelligent [man] getteth knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

16.text: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

17.text: He that is first in his own cause [seemeth] just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

18.text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

19.text: A brother offended is [harder to be won] than a strong city; and contentions are as the bars of a palace.

20.text: A man’s belly is satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; with the increase of his lips is he satisfied.

21.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

22.text: Whoso hath found a wife hath found a good thing, and hath obtained favour from Jehovah.

23.text: He that is poor speaketh with supplications, but the rich answereth roughly.

24.text: A man of [many] friends will come to ruin but there is a friend [that] sticketh closer than a brother.
